Based on your requirements, here's a rough estimate of the materials you'll need:

**Barbed Wire:**

* 500 feet of 12.5 gauge barbed wire is a good starting point for the initial repair and extension. To account for the next two repair jobs, let's double that to 1,500 feet. This will give you a comfortable surplus.
* You may also want to consider ordering a few extra rolls of wire to account for any future repairs or extensions. A standard roll of barbed wire is usually around 1,320 feet, so you could order 2-3 rolls to be safe.

**Wooden Stakes:**

* For corner posts, you'll need sturdier stakes to provide extra support. Let's assume you'll need 10-12 corner posts for the 500-foot stretch. For the surplus, add 20-24 more corner posts to account for the next two repair jobs.
* For line posts, you'll need more stakes spaced at regular intervals (usually 10-15 feet apart). For the 500-foot stretch, you'll need around 30-40 line posts. Add 60-80 more line posts to your order to account for the next two repair jobs.
* For the total order, you'll need:
	+ Corner posts: 30-36 stakes (10-12 for the initial repair + 20-24 for the surplus)
	+ Line posts: 90-120 stakes (30-40 for the initial repair + 60-80 for the surplus)

**Other Materials:**

* Don't forget to order wire stretcher bars, wire tighteners, and any other tools you may need to complete the repairs.

**Order Summary:**

* Barbed wire: 2-3 rolls (1,500-2,000 feet)
* Corner posts: 30-36 stakes (6 feet long, 4 inches in diameter)
* Line posts: 90-120 stakes (6 feet long, 4 inches in diameter)
* Wire stretcher bars, wire tighteners, and other tools as needed

Before placing your order, double-check your measurements and calculations to ensure you have enough materials. It's always better to have a little extra, but you don't want to overorder and waste resources.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions or need more assistance.
